title: Advanced Aeronautical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Work with the latest industry-standard software in a world-leading research department.
structure_json: {"Pre-study": {"groups": {"Pre-study": {"items": [{"title": "Revision Stress Analysis", "description": "Refresh your knowledge on the basics of stress analysis and learn about common stress analysis techniques."}, {"title": "Introduction to Programming", "description": "Learn about the scientific programming tools and languages required to perform numerical computation."}, {"title": "Introductory Mathematics", "description": "Revise essential mathematics."}, {"title": "Control Theory", "description": "Gain an insight into state-space methods for the analysis and design of control systems."}, {"title": "Introduction to Compressible Flow", "description": "Understand the basic effects of compressibility on fluid flow and evaluate the behaviour of compressible flows."}, {"title": "Aircraft Performance and Flight Mechanics", "description": "Refresh your knowledge of flight mechanics and how aircraft performance can be predicted on key characteristics."}, {"title": "Introduction to Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Refresher course on the basics of fluid mechanics."}]}}}, "Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerospace Structures", "description": "Learn how to analyse and design aerospace structures such as the wing and fuselage."}, {"title": "Applied Aerodynamics", "description": "Gain an understanding of the basic principles for the analysis and design of aerofoils and wings and learn about quantitative design."}, {"title": "Emerging Technology for Green Aviation", "description": "Explore the key technological advances and principles needed to achieve greener aviation. Become familiar with the main design challenges associated with achieving this goal."}, {"title": "Major Individual Research Project", "description": "Complete an extensive four-month individual research project, made up of a piece of individual research which must include some element of originality and can be wholly experimental, wholly theoretical, or a mixture of the two. You'll select projects from a list of topics proposed by university staff and by industry, and your work will be assessed by progress in conducting the work, a dissertation of about 10,000 words, and an oral presentation. "}, {"title": "Systems Engineering for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles", "description": "Improve your understanding of engineering systems and how to apply their tools to the design of UAVs."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of the relationship between design, manufacturing processing and materials properties and become familiar with the different types of manufacturing processes."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Conduct aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Aeroelasticity", "description": "Learn the theory and practice of aeroelasticity in fixed-wing aircraft and become familiar with the most common models used for aeroelastic analysis."}, {"title": "Aerothermodynamics of Launchers and ReEntry Vehicles", "description": "Explore the unique flow physics experienced by vehicles travelling at hypersonic speeds in an atmosphere and develop your understanding of aerodynamic analysis and experimentation."}, {"title": "Analytical Characterisation of Composite Materials", "description": "Uncover the advanced analytical techniques used to characterise the properties of polymers, fibres and fibre-matrix interfaces."}, {"title": "Artificial Intelligence for Aerospace Engineers", "description": "Become familiar with the most popular machine learning and AI algorithms used in the aerospace industry, and build on your existing knowledge of AI models."}, {"title": "Composite Innovation – Nanocomposites and Structural Power", "description": "Cultivate your knowledge of the latest composite innovations including nanophase reinforced composites and multifunctional composites."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Understand advanced concepts required for the application of the finite element method to the analysis of aerostructures."}, {"title": "Control Theory for Flow Management", "description": "Discover the rapidly expanding area of flow management and flow control while exploring novel ways in which fluid flow may be controlled."}, {"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Expand your understanding of the finite element method and learn about its practical use in solving structural problems."}, {"title": "Flow Instability & Transition", "description": "Learn how modern mathematical techniques are used to predict conditions when laminar-turbulent transition takes place."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Unpick the key principles of innovation management, from knowledge co-creation to developing sustainable business models."}, {"title": "Lightweight Structures", "description": "Explore the mechanics of composite materials and foams and learn best practice for analysing lightweight structures."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Structural Integrity and Health Monitoring", "description": "Gain an in-depth knowledge of the fundamentals of safe design and learn to apply damage detection techniques to different types of structures."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop your foundational knowledge and physical understanding to critically assess turbulent modules relevant to research and industry."}]}}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": title: Advanced Chemical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Undertake advanced study in chemical engineering and enhance your knowledge of basic sciences, mathematics and computing.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Process Design", "description": "Explore advanced topics in process design, with an emphasis on process modelling and optimisation theory and associated software packages."}, {"title": "Advanced Environmental Engineering", "description": "Analyse how chemical discharges affect the planet and how the increased greenhouse effect, ozone depletion, smog formation and acid rain arise from human influences on natural cycles."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules (Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and explore the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Advanced Optimisation for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Learn about state-of-the-art optimisation-based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, with a particular focus on mathematical programming."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Learn how to formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems through the use of optimality conditions and common solution techniques."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Understand a range of analytical techniques needed to address challenges being faced by industry and explore leading spectroscopic methods."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Explore the many techniques used in biotechnology that differ from chemical engineering, followed by a review of conventional downstream separation approaches including Cell Lysis, Extraction, Chromatography and more."}, {"title": "Colloid and Interface Science", "description": "Delve into the fundamentals of colloid and interface science and analyse the nature of the various interparticle forces."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour of Process Systems", "description": "Learn how to systematically develop physics-based models of chemical processes and solve them using state-of-the-art computational tools."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop a fundamental understanding of nonlinear dynamical systems to better appreciate complex phenomena in nature and a variety of chemical and biological engineering technological processes."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop your understanding of advanced statistical learning and machine learning to solve a range of real-life chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Learn the basic tools for modelling intracellular processes as well as modelling at cellular and higher levels."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}, {"title": "Practical Process Engineering in the Oil and Gas Industry", "description": "Understand the general workflows of facilities engineering teams and learn how to perform simple process and pipeline hydraulics hand calculations."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Develop your knowledge and experience in current experimental techniques and learn to analyse and apply these techniques to selected products."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Assess basic principles and concepts of fluid flow, heat and mass transfer relevant to physiological and biological systems, as well as more advanced mathematical models."}, {"title": "Industrial Automation and Autonomous Systems", "description": "Develop the ability to design and build automation solutions and autonomous systems for a wide range of industrial applications."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering", "description": "Acquire working knowledge to equip you for advanced coursework in machine learning, optimisation, dynamical systems, and numerical computations."}]}, "Optional modules (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Learn to apply mathematical and computational techniques to derive and solve equations of motion of fluids, which may be Newtonian or non-Newtonian, compressible or incompressible."}, {"title": "Carbon Capture and Clean Fossil Fuels", "description": "Understand the environmental impacts of fossil fuels and learn how to minimise the costs of CO 2 avoidance through the use of a range of technologies."}, {"title": "Membrane Science and Membrane Separation Processes", "description": "Develop your ability to formulate and solve engineering problems involving the design of membranes and membrane modules for gas separation, reverse osmosis, nanofiltration and more."}, {"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Explore your knowledge of particle technology and develop your skills in the key principles, concepts and technology to be confident to research and analyse a broader range of powder processing."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Carry out process heat transfer calculations to understand the basics and procedures to critically assess commercial codes in industry."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Explore the tools required for the application of new energy and renewable energy systems to the problems faced by climate change and global energy security while transitioning to a zero emissions economy."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Gain biodevice fabrication techniques and learn how to apply these in industry through topics such as microfluids, synthetic systems, and probes for innovative product design."}]}, "Business School (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Accounting Online", "description": "Develop accounting-related skills and examine their relevance to broader issues of financial decision-making and management control in organisations."}, {"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Analyse several economic tools and explore a range of microeconomic and macroeconomic topics, problems and policies."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Examine the relevance of financial and management accounting techniques in financial decision making and management control of organisations."}, {"title": "Corporate Finance Online", "description": "An introduction to financial markets and the role they place in the macroeconomy, and how business risk is transferred and priced in equity and dept securities."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered. This course is self-guided."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Enhance your accounting-related skills and gain a basic insight into the way that business performance is measured."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Become equipped with the skills needed to organise and shape the innovation process in firms and learn how to evaluate managerial strategies."}, {"title": "Managerial Economics Online", "description": "Explore the value to businesses of understanding economics, concepts, tolls and analytical frameworks as well as the role of monetary and fiscal policy on business cycles."}, {"title": "Project Management", "description": "Develop an understanding of Project Management and apply it's tools to analyse, interpret an provide solutions to strategic, organisational and operative challenges."}, {"title": "Leading Teams and Organisations", "description": "Develop and practise skills that will be used to identify, diagnose and evaluate key organisational issues and learn to work productively as a team."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee -": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Advanced Computing MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Study a range of advanced computing concepts and technologies alongside experts in the field.
structure_json: {"Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Computer Security", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the themes and challenges of host-level native, web, and mobile security and privacy."}, {"title": "Complexity", "description": "Discover how to describe the complexity classes associated with computational problems, and how to fit a particular problem into a class of related problems."}, {"title": "Computational Finance", "description": "Understand the basic concepts of quantitative finance and financial engineering and build awareness of the major decision, hedging, and pricing problems in finance."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning", "description": "Learn how to design and implement modern statistical machine learning methodologies, as well as inference mechanisms."}, {"title": "Privacy Engineering", "description": "Become familiar with the concepts and techniques underlying privacy-enhancing technologies across a variety of areas."}, {"title": "Program Analysis", "description": "Learn how to design program analyses for classical and probabilistic programs and how to solve the resulting equations and constraints."}, {"title": "Scalable Systems and Data", "description": "Advance your knowledge of the concepts that enable the design and implementation of scalable distributed systems."}, {"title": "Scalable Software Verification", "description": "Use separation logic to reason compositionally about sequential and concurrent heap-manipulating programs."}, {"title": "Reinforcement Learning", "description": "Learn how to describe the core principles of autonomous systems learning and calculate mathematical solutions to problems using reinforcement learning theory."}, {"title": "Prolog", "description": "Become familiar with Prolog and develop the knowledge and skills required to write small Prolog applications with an artificial intelligence dimension."}, {"title": "Introduction to Machine Learning", "description": "Gain insights into the different types of problems that exist in machine learning and the basic algorithms used to address them."}, {"title": "Scheduling and Resource Allocation", "description": "Assess the best decision algorithms for solving real-life problems arising in computer science, computational management and economics."}, {"title": "Independent Study Option", "description": "Study an advanced computer science topic of your choice and plan, write and present a scientific report."}, {"title": "Quantum Computing", "description": "Discover the basic notions of quantum computing and be introduced to Quantum Bits, Quantum Entanglement and Quantum Algorithms."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Graphics", "description": "Assess modern techniques in realistic computer graphics and image synthesis, particularly image-based techniques for photorealism."}, {"title": "Computational Optimisation", "description": "Develop a deeper understanding of optimal decision making models, algorithms and applications to engineering, finance, and machine learning."}, {"title": "Cryptography Engineering", "description": "Discover how cryptographic techniques can be used to design and implement secure communicating systems for a variety of different needs and applications."}, {"title": "Deep Learning", "description": "Explore the fundamental concepts and advanced methodologies of deep learning and relate them to real-world problems."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Imaging", "description": "Develop your knowledge of machine learning further by relating back to real-world problems in computer vision and medical image analysis."}, {"title": "Natural Language Processing", "description": "Acquire the techniques and tools needed to devise and develop natural language processing (NLP) components and applications."}, {"title": "Principles of Distributed Ledgers", "description": "Analyse the foundational principles behind decentralised ledgers and apply them to current research in cryptocurrencies."}, {"title": "Probabilistic Inference", "description": "Examine how probability can be used to make decisions by a computer and advance your understanding of inference networks and linear and non-linear methods in statistical pattern recognition."}, {"title": "Software Reliability", "description": "Assess techniques and tools for improving the reliability of software systems and discuss their respective strengths and weaknesses."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Industry", "description": "Examine the tools and techniques that software engineers use on a daily basis to successfully build and maintain large software systems."}, {"title": "Formal Methods for Safe AI", "description": "Develop intellectual and practical skills in the use of modal logics for knowledge representation and automated reasoning in artificial intelligence."}, {"title": "Robot Learning", "description": "Engage with the emerging field of robot learning and discover how robots can acquire skills and control their bodies using machine learning techniques."}, {"title": "Advanced Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of high-performance and energy-efficient computer architecture as a basis for informed software performance engineering."}, {"title": "Computer Vision", "description": "Explore how images are formed, how they are represented on computers and how they can be processed by computers to extract semantic information."}, {"title": "Graphics", "description": "Understand basic concepts of computer graphics and familiarise yourself with the mathematical principles used for computer generated imagery, shading and light approximations."}, {"title": "Custom Computing", "description": "Examine the approaches that enable the rapid and systematic design of custom computers and learn how to analyse the performance of a custom computer."}, {"title": "Distributed Algorithms", "description": "Unpick the key concepts, problems and results in distributed algorithms and gain practical experience of programming them."}, {"title": "Network and Web Security", "description": "Study network and web security broadly from the network to the application layer and understand the main threats, attack techniques and defences relevant to cybersecurity and network security."}, {"title": "System Performance Engineering", "description": "Analyse how performance engineering ensures computer systems are responsive, scalable, and efficient and explore the fundamental principles and techniques used to achieve these goals."}, {"title": "Logic-Based Learning", "description": "Gain an in-depth understanding of the state-of-the-art of logic-based learning, starting from its key foundation concepts and principles before moving to more recent advances."}, {"title": "Computational Neurodynamics", "description": "Understand the rationale behind the theoretical end of computational neuroscience and basic principles of the tools needed to simulate the brain's intelligent behaviour in this interdisciplinary module."}, {"title": "Deep Graph-Based Learning", "description": "Gain a flavour of different aspects of the broad and ever-expanding field of graph theory and learning, including conventional graph data analysis methods and the nascent field of graph neural networks."}, {"title": "Human-Robot Interaction", "description": "Explore the intersection of robotics and human-computer interaction, covering user-centric and user study design, data analysis, and relevant theoretical foundations, in this exciting new field."}, {"title": "Methods and Tools in the Theory of Computing", "description": "Learn elementary tools, methods and results relating to fundamental questions in the theory and practice computing."}, {"title": "Statistical Information Theory", "description": "Delve into the deep connections between information theory, statistics and machine learning, in this module linking computing, statistics and geometry. Includes mathematical and computational exercises, and provides crucial theoretical background for a career in data science or machine learning."}, {"title": "Software Engineering for Machine Learning Systems", "description": "In this course, you will learn how to build reliable systems that use machine learning, from data ingestion to user experience. You will gain hands-on experience running a simplified ML system in a simulated real world setting."}, {"title": "Networked Systems", "description": "Learn how modern networked systems are built and gain hands-on experience with their design and implementation. You will explore new architectures, hardware and software infrastructure, and core principles such as layering and the end-to-end argument."}, {"title": "Non-Euclidean Methods in Machine Learning", "description": "Learn to build machine learning models that work with non-Euclidean data. You will study embeddings, optimization techniques from Riemannian geometry, and graph theory, and apply neural networks designed for data on curved spaces and manifolds."}, {"title": "Introduction to Concrete Complexity", "description": "Explore why some problems are hard to solve but easy to check, including the famous P vs NP question. You will learn simple tools from circuit and proof complexity to tackle these challenges."}, {"title": "Machine Learning Systems and Hardware", "description": "Investigate how modern hardware and systems make machine learning work in practice. From GPUs and TPUs to efficient ML techniques and large-scale deployment, you will get hands-on experience running models across cloud and edge environments."}]}}}, "Individual Project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Advanced Materials Science and Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Specialise in materials for energy transition and develop your passion for exploring and creating innovative materials.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Characterisation of the Structure of Materials", "description": "Gain a firm foundation in the fundamentals of the characterisation of the structure of materials."}, {"title": "Theory and Simulation of Materials", "description": "Become familiar with a selection of important modelling techniques and use these title: Advanced Materials for Sustainable Infrastructure MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
course_overview: Learn about the behaviour and characteristics of civil engineering materials in depth.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Concrete Materials", "description": "Explore the field of concrete technology and understand the key processes influencing the behaviour and performance of concrete in service."}, {"title": "Materials Selection", "description": "Discover the role of materials selection in the design process and learn how to select appropriate materials for different civil engineering applications."}, {"title": "Mechanics of Materials", "description": "Gain an insight into the fundamental principles of the mechanics of materials and analyse the behaviour of structural components under load."}, {"title": "Geomaterials", "description": "Learn how to describe rocks and soils and interpret test data. You'll also examine how the engineering properties of geomaterials influence the behaviour of pavements and structures."}, {"title": "Sustainable Development", "description": "Apply the principles of sustainability to a range of issues relating to the built environment and discover how to carry out a life cycle assessment of infrastructure elements."}, {"title": "Characterisation of Materials", "description": "Understand the capabilities and limitations of mechanical testing and examine appropriate methods for tackling problems."}, {"title": "Cementitious Materials", "description": "Discover why cementitious materials are used throughout the built environment and learn about the chemistry behind them."}, {"title": "Polymers and Polymer Composites", "description": "Appreciate the development and applications of polymers and polymer composites in civil engineering."}, {"title": "Metals", "description": "Enhance your knowledge of the use of metals and alloys in civil engineering and deepen your understanding of steel metallurgy."}, {"title": "Numerical Modelling of Materials", "description": "Explore the principles, applications and limitations of numerical models as applied to infrastructure materials."}, {"title": "Masonry, Timber and Glass", "description": "Understand the types of masonry, timber and glass available for the construction of buildings and evaluate where the use of these materials is likely to be appropriate or problematic."}, {"title": "Assessment, Monitoring and Repair of Structures", "description": "Learn how to plan a durability survey to assess the condition of a concrete structure and understand different testing and monitoring techniques."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee (CEE 1YFT + 2YPT)": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": title: Advanced Mechanical Engineering MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Broaden your knowledge of key areas of mechanical engineering and explore recent developments in the field.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Professional Engineering Skills", "description": "Develop a range of skills necessary for the role of the professional engineer. title: Analogue and Digital Integrated Circuit Design MSc | Study | Imperial College London
delivered_by: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
course_overview: Gain experience in the practical issues of device-level design and system-level performance requirements.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Analogue Integrated Circuits and Systems", "description": "Understand analogue-integrated circuits and systems in CMOS and Bipolar technologies."}, {"title": "Full-Custom Integrated Circuit Design", "description": "Advance your knowledge of CMOS Technology, the industry mainstream for circuits."}, {"title": "Advanced Digital System Design", "description": "Learn how to design, implement, analyse and optimise advanced digital systems."}, {"title": "Analogue Signal Processing", "description": "Discover the analogue signal processing techniques that can be used to perform computation."}, {"title": "ADIC Laboratory Experiments", "description": "Develop advanced skills in utilising industry-strength electronic design automation tools for microelectronic design."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Computer Architecture", "description": "Develop a thorough understanding of high-performance and energy-efficient computer architecture."}, {"title": "Advanced deep learning systems", "description": "Analyse and assess the principles of modern deep learning systems."}, {"title": "Applied electronic devices", "description": "Examine the process of downsizing transistors to finFETs and transitioning to stacks of nanowire and nanosheet transistors."}, {"title": "Biomedical electronics", "description": "Familiarise yourself with how biomedical electronics can be used to create medical devices that interface with the human body."}, {"title": "Communications: Physical Layer", "description": "Study the sources and detectors used in radio and optical communication links, and the behaviour of their signals as they propagate in various media."}, {"title": "Digital Signal Processing and Digital Filters", "description": "Gain a thorough grounding in the design of digital filters and in multirate signal processing techniques."}, {"title": "Hardware and Software Verification", "description": "Explore the techniques used to verify software and hardware, including formal verification tools, interactive theorem-provers and automatic software verification tools."}, {"title": "High Performance Analogue Electronics", "description": "Examine the design and implementation of high performance, analogue-integrated circuits and systems."}, {"title": "Instrumentation", "description": "Unravel electrical measurement theory and practice, especially at GHz frequencies, and understand measurement capabilities and limitations."}, {"title": "MEMS and Nanotechnology", "description": "Discover the underlying physical principles, methods of fabrication and applications of a broad range of micro- and nano-scale devices and systems."}, {"title": "Microwave Technology", "description": "Deepen your knowledge of the fundamental principles and applications of microwave technology."}, {"title": "Radio Frequency Subsystems", "description": "Broaden your understanding of the terminology, concepts and basic methods of radio frequency design."}, {"title": "Sensor systems and networks", "description": "Learn how sensor systems are implemented and deployed to provide optimal information about the physical world."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee": {"items": []}, title: Advanced Chemical Engineering with Biotechnology MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Build an interdisciplinary background in chemical engineering and biological sciences for a career in biotech.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Process Design", "description": "Explore advanced topics in process design, with an emphasis on process modelling and optimisation theory and associated software packages."}, {"title": "Advanced Bioprocess Engineering", "description": "Review the relevant fundamentals of biochemistry, microbiology, and molecular biology, and explore the principles behind fermentation processes."}, {"title": "Biochemical Engineering", "description": "Gain insights into the techniques used in biotechnology, which in many cases differ markedly from chemical engineering."}, {"title": "Modelling of Biological Systems", "description": "Interlink the biological principles of cellular physiology with the mathematical tools required for their analysis and modelling."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules (Level 7)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Environmental Engineering", "description": "Analyse how chemical discharges affect the planet and how the increased greenhouse effect, ozone depletion, smog formation and acid rain arise from human influences on natural cycles."}, {"title": "Advanced Optimisation for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Learn about state-of-the-art optimisation-based techniques for process synthesis, process design and molecular design, with a particular focus on mathematical programming."}, {"title": "Advanced Process Operations", "description": "Learn how to formulate, solve and interpret meaningful optimisation problems through the use of optimality conditions and common solution techniques."}, {"title": "Applied Spectroscopy", "description": "Understand a range of analytical techniques needed to address challenges being faced by industry and explore leading spectroscopic methods."}, {"title": "Colloid and Interface Science", "description": "Delve into the fundamentals of colloid and interface science and analyse the nature of the various interparticle forces."}, {"title": "Dynamic Behaviour of Process Systems", "description": "Learn how to develop models of the transient behaviour of process equipment using state-of-the-art modelling tools."}, {"title": "Dynamical Systems in Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop a fundamental understanding of nonlinear dynamical systems to better appreciate complex phenomena in nature and a variety of chemical and biological engineering technological processes."}, {"title": "Machine Learning for Chemical Engineering", "description": "Develop your understanding of advanced statistical learning and machine learning to solve a range of real-life chemical engineering problems."}, {"title": "Molecular Modelling of Fluids", "description": "Understand the application of molecular theory and simulation in modelling fluids and fluid mixtures."}, {"title": "Practical Process Engineering in the Oil and Gas Industry", "description": "Understand the general workflows of facilities engineering teams and learn how to perform simple process and pipeline hydraulics hand calculations."}, {"title": "Product Characterisation", "description": "Develop your knowledge and experience in current experimental techniques and learn to analyse and apply these techniques to selected products."}, {"title": "Transport Processes in Biological Systems", "description": "Assess basic principles and concepts of fluid flow, heat and mass transfer relevant to physiological and biological systems, as well as more advanced mathematical models."}, {"title": "Industrial Automation and Autonomous Systems", "description": "Develop the ability to design and build automation solutions and autonomous systems for a wide range of industrial applications."}, {"title": "Mathematics for Machine Learning and Process Systems Engineering", "description": "Acquire working knowledge to equip you for advanced coursework in machine learning, optimisation, dynamical systems, and numerical computations."}]}, "Optional modules (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Fluid Mechanics", "description": "Learn to apply mathematical and computational techniques to derive and solve equations of motion of fluids, which may be Newtonian or non-Newtonian, compressible or incompressible."}, {"title": "Carbon Capture and Clean Fossil Fuels", "description": "Understand the environmental impacts of fossil fuels and learn how to minimise the costs of CO 2 avoidance through the use of a range of technologies."}, {"title": "Membrane Science and Membrane Separation Processes", "description": "Develop your ability to formulate and solve engineering problems involving the design of membranes and membrane modules for gas separation, reverse osmosis, nanofiltration and more."}, {"title": "Nuclear Chemical Engineering", "description": "Investigate the main chemical engineering processes associated with nuclear energy and work through problems related to mass and energy balance."}, {"title": "Particle Engineering", "description": "Explore your knowledge of particle technology and develop your skills in the key principles, concepts and technology to be confident to research and analyse a broader range of powder processing."}, {"title": "Process Heat Transfer", "description": "Carry out process heat transfer calculations to understand the basics and procedures to critically assess commercial codes in industry."}, {"title": "Sustainable Energy Technologies", "description": "Explore the tools required for the application of new energy and renewable energy systems to the problems faced by climate change and global energy security while transitioning to a zero emissions economy."}, {"title": "Biochemical Sensors", "description": "Gain biodevice fabrication techniques and learn how to apply these in industry through topics such as microfluids, synthetic systems, and probes for innovative product design."}]}, "Business School (Level 6)": {"items": [{"title": "Accounting Online", "description": "Develop accounting-related skills and examine their relevance to broader issues of financial decision-making and management control in organisations."}, {"title": "Business Economics", "description": "Analyse several economic tools and explore a range of microeconomic and macroeconomic topics, problems and policies."}, {"title": "Business Strategy", "description": "Examine the relevance of financial and management accounting techniques in financial decision making and management control of organisations."}, {"title": "Corporate Finance Online", "description": "An introduction to financial markets and the role they place in the macroeconomy, and how business risk is transferred and priced in equity and dept securities."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered."}, {"title": "Entrepreneurship Online", "description": "Introduction to the entrepreneurship module, using the key methods, knowledge, skills and tools used in starting up a new business and the challenges and issues encountered. This course is self-guided."}, {"title": "Finance and Financial Management", "description": "Enhance your accounting-related skills and gain a basic insight into the way that business performance is measured."}, {"title": "Managing Innovation", "description": "Become equipped with the skills needed to organise and shape the innovation process in firms and learn how to evaluate managerial strategies."}, {"title": "Managerial Economics Online", "description": "Explore the value to businesses of understanding economics, concepts, tolls and analytical frameworks as well as the role of monetary and fiscal policy on business cycles."}, {"title": "Project Management", "description": "Develop an understanding of Project Management and apply it's tools to analyse, interpret an provide solutions to strategic, organisational and operative challenges."}, {"title": "Leading Teams and Organisations", "description": "Develop and practise skills that will be used to identify, diagnose and evaluate key organisational issues and learn to work productively as a team."}]}}}, "Research project": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee -": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Advanced Computational Methods for Aeronautics, Flow Management and Fluid-Structure Interaction MSc | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop specialist computational knowledge for a career in aerospace or engineering.

title: Advanced Molecular Synthesis MRes | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Develop skills in synthetic chemistry with a focus on approaches to automate, analyse and understand synthetic processes.
structure_json: {"Core modules": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Fundamental Reactive Intermediates", "description": "Discover fundamental and recent advances in the use of reactive intermediates in synthesis."}, {"title": "AMS Journal Clubs", "description": "Discuss current research in a collaborative environment. You'll also work as a group to present on a chosen topic."}, {"title": "Research Proposal", "description": "The research proposal assesses your aptitude to critically analyse published scientific literature and helps you plan towards your research project."}, {"title": "Programming in Python", "description": "Become familiar with Python as a general purpose programming language, as well as specific data processing features and libraries."}]}}}, "Optional modules": {"groups": {"Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Advanced Stereochemistry, Synthesis and Biosynthesis", "description": "Develop a high-level understanding of the tactics and strategies deployed in complex molecule and natural products synthesis and biosynthesis."}, {"title": "Automation in Chemistry, Drug Discovery and Materials", "description": "Review state-of-the-art 'enabling technologies' and explore low-cost open-source automated systems."}, {"title": "Data Analytics in Chemistry", "description": "Gain a grounding in data science and machine learning approaches, and learn to apply these to large data sets."}]}}}, "Research Project in Advanced Molecular Synthesis": {"groups": {}}, "Minimum academic requirement": {"groups": {"": {"items": []}}}, "English language requirement": {"groups": {}}, "International qualifications": {"groups": {}}, "Home fee": {"groups": {"Home fee - MRes Chemistry courses": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}, "Overseas fee": {"groups": {"Overseas fee - MRes Chemistry courses": {"items": []}, "Inflationary increases": {"items": []}, "Which fee you pay": {"items": []}, "Postgraduate Master's Loan": {"items": []}}}}

title: Aeronautical Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Learn how vehicles and structures interact with air in this professionally accredited, integrated Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 1", "description": "Discover the fundamentals of aerodynamics, such as the basic laws of motion for incompressible fluid flow, mass conservation, and viscosity."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 1", "description": "Learn the key constructs and thought processes that will help you to solve engineering problems and become a MATLAB and Python scripting expert."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 1", "description": "Engage in engineering practice, and know the practical, legal, ethical, and manufacturing constraints, so you can come up with creative solutions."}, {"title": "Introduction to Aerospace", "description": "Formulate equations to predict key performance metrics like cruise range, operating envelope, and take-off and landing for different types of vehicles operating."}, {"title": "Materials 1", "description": "Determine the relationship between microstructure and mechanical response of engineering materials and natural materials. Stress analysis, solid mechanics, and material selection are introduced."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Become knowledgeable and skilled in mathematics in order to prepare for the first-year aeronautical programme and for the more advanced techniques required in later years."}, {"title": "Mechanics", "description": "Develop your understanding of Newtonian physics, particle dynamics, and momentum, as well as structural mechanics, dynamics, and flight mechanics."}, {"title": "Structures 1", "description": "Understand equilibrium, compatibility, stress/strain law, and other fundamentals of structural analysis."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer", "description": "Study thermodynamics, gas dynamics, and heat transfer before moving on to more advanced modules, like propulsion and aerodynamics."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 2", "description": "Explore incompressible and compressible aerodynamics and basic prediction methods for designing aerofoils."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 2", "description": "Develop your programming skills with the help of a compiled language (C++), and learn further numerical analysis techniques that you will need in both the Aeronautics course and, thereafter, in industry."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Project Development", "description": "Understand your customers and their needs, plan and cost the project, identify and mitigate risks, and create a project proposal. During subsequent projects, you will use the skills you learn in this module."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Technical", "description": "Know the practical, legal, ethical, and manufacturing constraints engineers must contend with when solving problems or planning projects."}, {"title": "Flight Dynamics and Control", "description": "Develop a working knowledge of flight vehicle dynamics, stability, and control. We review both the theoretical background and its practical application of predicting and controlling aircraft dynamics using the Department's Flight Simulation facility."}, {"title": "Materials 2", "description": "Learn how to predict failures under multiaxial loading that occur due to yielding, fractures, fatigue, and creep, and identify these failure mechanisms in practice."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Become familiar with probability and statistics, plus vector calculus and numerical analysis."}, {"title": "Mechatronics", "description": "Using 'system' concepts and Mechatronics, learn how to model electrical systems with mechanical systems."}, {"title": "Propulsion and Turbomachinery", "description": "Learn about ramjets, turbojets, and turbofans' theory, starting with the thermodynamic cycle before diving into individual components' aero-thermal properties."}, {"title": "Structures 2", "description": "Get an overview of matrix methods in overall structural analysis (hardness and flexibility), and structural dynamics (force equilibrium, Hamilton's principle, and Lagrange's equation)."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 3", "description": "Use compressible and incompressible aerodynamics, boundary layers, and finite aspect ratio wings to design aerospace vehicles."}, {"title": "Aerospace Vehicle Design", "description": "Develop a conventional aircraft using a basic set of operational requirements and integrating your prior knowledge and analytical skills and learn how vehicles are designed using multi-stage approaches."}, {"title": "Control Systems", "description": "Discover how automatic control systems are used in a wide range of technologies (not just Aeronautics, but Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Finance, Biology)."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Take part in one of our five challenging research projects each year to learn about industrial engineering design in a large multidisciplinary team."}, {"title": "Structures 3", "description": "Apply structural principles to thin-walled structures representing aeroplane parts. Since modern aircraft are usually composites, learn homogeneous plate theory."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Through I-Explore, you'll have the chance to deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules. All undergraduate courses include one module from I-Explore's wide selection. The module you choose will be fully integrated into your course's curriculum and count as credit towards your degree."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Develop your understanding of the Finite Element Method, which uses a powerful mathematical abstraction based on function spaces, inner products, norms, and operators."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Find out about orbital mechanics, rigid body dynamics, and path planning problems, like time or fuel optimisation. Analysis of spacecraft motion, stability, and control is also included."}, {"title": "Advanced Fluid Dynamics and Fluid-Structure Interaction", "description": "Deploy advanced mathematical tools to analyse the broad scope of phenome related to fluid flows and their interaction with structures."}, {"title": "Mathematics 3", "description": "Learn about variational calculus and its applications, plus complex variables and techniques based on them. This approach is useful for designing hypersonic nosecones and deriving potential flow solutions."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop the background knowledge and physical understanding you need to evaluate turbulent models critically."}, {"title": "Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Develop a solid understanding of the theory and implementation of primarily 1D numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Learn how to solve two-dimensional potential, electrostatic and acoustic problems using the finite element method and Boundary Element method."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Advance your knowledge of aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Create an innovative culture, network, and creativity through open innovation practices."}, {"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Understand the manufacturing processes of composite materials and their corresponding underlying manufacturing principles.."}, {"title": "High Performance Computing", "description": "Build proficiency in the use of the C++ programming language and the skills to be able to write efficient parallel programs."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Discover how to analyse and design spacecraft systems using an industry-standard methodology covering mission objectives, requirements analysis, political and regulatory constraints, and financial considerations."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Learn about current methods for designing spacecraft structures, including launchers, satellite platforms, and inflatable habitats."}, {"title": "Optimisation (IDX)", "description": "Examine the concepts and techniques associated with modern optimisation theory and practice."}, {"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing (IDX)", "description": "Analyse how additive manufacturing is helping solve future industry challenges and build your knowledge of advanced manufacturing methodologies."}, {"title": "Flow Instability and Transition", "description": "Learn how modern mathematical techniques are used to predict conditions when laminar-turbulent transition takes place."}, {"title": "Artificial Intelligence for Aerospace Engineers", "description": "Explore the most popular Machine Learning and AI algorithms used in aerospace research and industry."}, {"title": "Lightweight Structures", "description": "Discover the mechanics of composite materials and foams, sandwich construction, and how lightweight structures are analysed, including design optimisation."}, {"title": "Aeroelasticity", "description": "Study the theory and practice of aeroelasticity in fixed-wing aircraft, including structural dynamics and turbulence dynamics, and how deformed air vehicles affect control."}, {"title": "Applications of Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Discover the key numerical methods used for solving the governing equations of fluid dynamics for aerodynamic title: Aeronautics with Spacecraft Engineering MEng | Study | Imperial College London
course_overview: Specialise in the design of space technologies in this professionally accredited, integrated Master's degree.
structure_json: {"Year 1": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 1", "description": "Become familiar with aerodynamic essentials including  the basic laws of motion for incompressible fluid flow."}, {"title": "Structures 1", "description": "Discover the fundamental concepts for all structural analysis and learn how to apply them."}, {"title": "Mathematics 1", "description": "Approach mathematics as a logical and structured discipline and acquire the skills needed to move on to more advanced study."}, {"title": "Mechanics", "description": "Explore classical mechanics and develop your understanding of statics, kinematics and dynamics."}, {"title": "Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer", "description": "Learn the essentials of thermodynamics, gas dynamics, and heat transfer and build your foundational knowledge of propulsion and aerodynamics for more advanced study."}, {"title": "Materials 1", "description": "Examine the microstructure and mechanical response of all classes of engineering and natural materials."}, {"title": "Introduction to Aerospace", "description": "Learn about the broad types of aerial vehicles operating and their varied missions and design requirements, plus how equations can help predict key aircraft performance metrics."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 1", "description": "Acquire the basic computing and programming skills required for the solution of engineering problems."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 1", "description": "Engage in engineering practice and learn why engineers need an awareness of practical, legal, ethical and manufacturing constraints."}]}}}, "Year 2": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 2", "description": "Build on your existing knowledge of incompressible and compressible aerodynamics, and the basic prediction methods for aerofoil design at both low and high speed."}, {"title": "Structures 2", "description": "Advance your understanding of mechanics and structures and explore topics including matrix methods in overall structural analysis, structural dynamics and buckling."}, {"title": "Mathematics 2", "description": "Explore more advanced mathematics concepts including vector calculus, partial differential equations, and the theory of signals and systems."}, {"title": "Mechatronics", "description": "Obtain a fundamental grounding in the theory and practice of mechatronic systems relevant to aeronautics."}, {"title": "Propulsion and Turbomachinery", "description": "Uncover the fundamental theory of jet engines, including ramjets, turbojets and turbofans and examine the aero-thermal analysis of individual components in detail."}, {"title": "Materials 2", "description": "Further your understanding on the principles of aerospace materials and learn about emerging materials for future aerospace applications."}, {"title": "Flight Dynamics and Control", "description": "Examine the concepts associated with the dynamics, stability and control of flight vehicles and discover the techniques available to predict and control the dynamic behaviour of aircraft."}, {"title": "Computing and Numerical Methods 2", "description": "Enhance your programming skills and learn about programming with a compiled language (C++) as well as further numerical analysis techniques."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Technical", "description": "Engage in multi-disciplinary design and optimisation work and build on your knowledge of engineering practice from your first year studies."}, {"title": "Engineering Practice 2 – Project Development", "description": "Discover the basic considerations involved in developing, planning and costing a project as well as how to identify and mitigate associated risks."}]}}}, "Year 3": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Aerodynamics 3", "description": "Deepen your understanding of the compressible and incompressible aerodynamics relevant to aerospace vehicle design."}, {"title": "Structures 3", "description": "Explore idealised thin-walled structures and plate theory as you build on the structural principles developed during your earlier studies."}, {"title": "Control Systems", "description": "Build on your prior understanding of dynamical systems and examine fundamental concepts in the analysis and design of automatic control systems."}, {"title": "Aerospace Vehicle Design", "description": "Integrate and apply your prior knowledge and analytical skills to the design of an aircraft and learn about the methods typically employed by vehicle design teams."}, {"title": "Group Design Project", "description": "Learn how to function and contribute creatively in a large multi-disciplinary team, simulating the industrial approach to engineering design and teamwork."}, {"title": "I-Explore", "description": "Deepen your knowledge in a brand new subject area, chosen from a huge range of for-credit modules."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}]}}}, "Year 4": {"groups": {"Core modules": {"items": [{"title": "Individual Project", "description": "Complete an individual research project in your chosen area of research, which must include some element of originality."}]}, "Optional modules - Group A": {"items": [{"title": "Spacecraft Systems", "description": "Learn industry standard methodology for spacecraft systems analysis and design."}, {"title": "Spacecraft Structures", "description": "Develop your understanding of methodologies for spacecraft structure design, from launchers to satellite platforms to habitable inflatable modules."}, {"title": "Aerothermodynamics of Launchers and Re-Entry Vehicles", "description": "Explore the unique flow physics experienced by vehicles travelling at hypersonic speeds in an atmosphere and develop your understanding of aerodynamic analysis and experimentation."}, {"title": "Orbital Mechanics", "description": "Apply orbital mechanics and rigid body mechanics to a wide range of problems in non-atmospheric flight."}]}, "Optional modules": {"items": [{"title": "Finite Elements", "description": "Develop your understanding of the Finite Element Method, which uses a powerful mathematical abstraction based on function spaces, inner products, norms, and operators."}, {"title": "Advanced Fluid Dynamics and Fluid-Structure Interaction", "description": "Deploy advanced mathematical tools to analyse the broad scope of phenome related to fluid flows and their interaction with structures."}, {"title": "Mathematics 3", "description": "Learn about variational calculus and its applications, plus complex variables and techniques based on them. This approach is useful for designing hypersonic nosecones and deriving potential flow solutions."}, {"title": "Turbulence and Turbulence Modelling", "description": "Develop the background knowledge and physical understanding you need to evaluate turbulent models critically."}, {"title": "Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Develop a solid understanding of the theory and implementation of primarily 1D numerical methods for computational fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Computational Mechanics", "description": "Learn how to solve two-dimensional potential, electrostatic and acoustic problems using the finite element method and Boundary Element method."}, {"title": "Advanced Propulsion", "description": "Advance your knowledge of aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis of propulsion systems for high-speed flight."}, {"title": "Innovation Management", "description": "Create an innovative culture, network, and creativity through open innovation practices."}, {"title": "Advanced Manufacturing", "description": "Understand the manufacturing processes of composite materials and their corresponding underlying manufacturing principles.."}, {"title": "High Performance Computing", "description": "Build proficiency in the use of the C++ programming language and the skills to be able to write efficient parallel programs."}, {"title": "Applications of Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Gain a better understanding of the physics and governing equations of fluid dynamics."}, {"title": "Applications of Computational Fluid Dynamics", "description": "Discover the key numerical methods used for solving the governing equations of fluid dynamics for aerodynamic design."}, {"title": "Lightweight Structures", "description": "Discover the mechanics of composite materials and foams, sandwich construction, and how lightweight structures are analysed, including design optimisation."}, {"title": "Aeroelasticity", "description": "Study the theory and practice of aeroelasticity in fixed-wing aircraft, including structural dynamics and turbulence dynamics, and how deformed air vehicles affect control."}, {"title": "Optimisation (IDX)", "description": "Examine the concepts and techniques associated with modern optimisation theory and practice."}, {"title": "Design for Additive Manufacturing (IDX)", "description": "Analyse how additive manufacturing is helping solve future industry challenges and build your knowledge of advanced manufacturing methodologies."}, {"title": "Flow Instability and Transition", "description": "Learn how modern mathematical techniques are used to predict conditions when laminar-turbulent transition takes place."}, {"title": "Artificial Intelligence for Aerospace Engineers", "description": "Explore the most popular Machine Learning and AI algorithms used in aerospace research and industry."}, {"title": "BPES / Horizons (level 6 or 7)", "description": "Gain a greater understanding of the financial, strategic and operational context of your core discipline."}]}}}, "A-levels": {"groups": {"Minimum entry standard": {"items": []}, "Typical offer": {"items": []}, "Support for widening participation applicants":
